data.chText: 最低的；最小的；最低限度的
data.enText: the smallest that is possible or allowed; extremely small

data.chText: 做这项工作没费什么劲。
data.enText: The work was done with the minimum amount of effort.

data.chText: 你需要200英镑作为你假日的最低开销。
data.enText: You'll need £200 minimum for your holiday expenses.

data.chText: 最小值；最少量；最低限度
data.enText: the smallest or lowest amount that is possible, required or recorded

data.chText: 成本应保持在最低限度。
data.enText: costs should be kept to a minimum .

data.chText: 这个班最少需要六名学生才可以继续办下去。
data.enText: The class needs a minimum of six students to continue.

data.chText: 你每天晚上应花两个小时学习，这绝对是最低要求。
data.enText: As an absolute minimum , you should spend two hours in the evening studying.
Temperatures will fall to a minimum of 10 degrees.

data.chText: 他没费什么劲就通过了考试。
data.enText: He passed the exams with the minimum of effort.

tr: the point on a curve where the tangent changes from negative on the left to positive on the right

example: a minimal charge for the service

value.def: You use minimum to describe an amount which is the smallest that is possible, allowed, or required.

example.ex: He was only five feet nine, the minimum height for a policeman.
example.tran: 他只有5英尺9英寸高，刚刚达到当警察的最低身高要求。

example.ex: This will take a minimum of one hour...
example.tran: 这至少要花去一个小时。

example.ex: Four foot should be seen as an absolute minimum.
example.tran: 绝对不能比4英尺再少了。

value.def: You use minimum to state how small an amount is.

example.ex: The basic needs of life are available with minimum effort...
example.tran: 稍加努力就能满足生活的基本需求。

example.ex: Neil and Chris try to spend the minimum amount of time on the garden.
example.tran: 尼尔与克里斯想尽可能少花时间打理花园。

example.ex: With a minimum of fuss, she produced the grandson he had so desperately wished for.
example.tran: 没经过多少忙乱，她就生了一个他做梦都想要的孙子。

value.def: If you say that something is a particular amount minimum, you mean that this is the smallest amount it should be or could possibly be, although a larger amount is acceptable or very possible.

example.ex: You're talking over a thousand pounds minimum for one course.
example.tran: 你说的可是一门课程收费至少1,000英镑。

value.def: You use at a minimum, or at the minimum, when you want to indicate that something is the very least which could or should happen.

example.ex: This would take three months at a minimum...
At the minimum, they must be guaranteed against any form of further attack.
example.tran: 至少要保证他们不再受到任何形式的攻击。

gramarinfo.label: amount PHR, PHR with cl, PHR after v

value.def: If you say that someone keeps something to a minimum, or to the minimum, you mean that they keep the amount of it as small as possible.

example.ex: Office machinery is kept to a minimum...
example.tran: 办公室的机器数量维持在最低限度。

example.ex: She has now cut her teaching hours to the minimum.
example.tran: 她现在已经把她的教学时间减至最低限度。

value.tran: 尽可能少的数量;最低限度
